channel.title: Help with an original Music System. Revolutionary Runescape Private Servers
channel.description:
Hey guys, ive you've ever played BlazeScape, then you would know that they have a original Music System, but ive just figured out the main concept, but i have no idea how to implement it in-game.
Well, is there anyway for specific places to play a specfic sound, or song from my music list? For example, when they log into the server, i want it to place a specific sound, i have it in my "music" Folder, but now what?
I know this is CLIENT+SERVER related, but seriously, just this once help a guy out who is trying to do something, which has only ever been done once (to my knowledge)
thanks a lot guys!!!
~Johno

item.title: Help with an original Music System. Revolutionary Runescape Private Servers
item.dc:creator: @johno2 johno2
item.description:
@johno2 wrote:

zyle1992:

Then you don’t know your wat around a server’s coding. If you can’t get the gist of an explanation like that, with comments, then google. And this isn’t in the server, it’s in the client. You can have it be in the server, but it would just cause more lag to it.

like i said, i know what it;s doing, and why it’s doing it, i completely understand it, but sitting down and typing it like you, im no where near that part of scripting yet.

Read full topic
item.source: Help with an original Music System. Revolutionary Runescape Private Servers

item.title: Help with an original Music System. Revolutionary Runescape Private Servers
item.dc:creator: @johno2 johno2
item.description:
@johno2 wrote:

Where would i place that method? Which process? [br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 11, 2009, 12:16:11 pm[/size][hr]I got these errors

[code]--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

       Welcome to BlazeScape's compiler, thankyou for using me.

Note: Remember the rule if you get 100 errors
You need a } for every {
Errors will show up if any below the line.

                                Errors:

client.java:51: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable playerDef
location: class client
if(playerDef.isInArea(3200, 3400, 3300, 3400)) {//isInArea would just be a boole
an method(int posX1, int posY1, int posX2, int posY2)
^
client.java:52: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable musicPlayer
location: class client
musicPlayer.playSong(“jingle0”);//Or whatever you want to call it
^
Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
2 errors
Compiling Finished.
Press any key to continue . . .[/code][br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 11, 2009, 12:21:12 pm[/size][hr][quote=“zyle1992, post:4, topic:288220”]My bad, I though you meant the original Runescape music that was in the cache…

Let’s see, for custom music(like linkin park or whatever), you would PROBABLY have to look in a 317 client update log(probably hard to find these days), and then see what field was the getX(), getY(), getHeight(). etc(maybe look in a renamed client?) and then find where those methods are called, then get the PlayerDef(or whatever you want to call it) class in the client, then do something like:

if(playerDef.isInArea(3200, 3400, 3300, 3400)) {//isInArea would just be a boolean method(int posX1, int posY1, int posX2, int posY2)
    musicPlayer.playSong("Breaking the habit");//Or whatever you want to call it

}

or something along those lines.[/quote]

Mate, ok, im a noob when it comes down to shizzle like this, i know my way around a servers codeing, but actually sitting down and start typing stuff from scratch, i have NO chance!!

Read full topic
item.source: Help with an original Music System. Revolutionary Runescape Private Servers

item.title: Help with an original Music System. Revolutionary Runescape Private Servers
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

My bad, I though you meant the original Runescape music that was in the cache…

Let’s see, for custom music(like linkin park or whatever), you would PROBABLY have to look in a 317 client update log(probably hard to find these days), and then see what field was the getX(), getY(), getHeight(). etc(maybe look in a renamed client?) and then find where those methods are called, then get the PlayerDef(or whatever you want to call it) class in the client, then do something like:

if(playerDef.isInArea(3200, 3400, 3300, 3400)) {//isInArea would just be a boolean method(int posX1, int posY1, int posX2, int posY2)
    musicPlayer.playSong("Breaking the habit");//Or whatever you want to call it

}

or something along those lines.

Read full topic
item.source: Help with an original Music System. Revolutionary Runescape Private Servers

item.title: Help with an original Music System. Revolutionary Runescape Private Servers
item.dc:creator: @johno2 johno2
item.description:
@johno2 wrote:

zyle1992:

I believe back in '07 silab posted a tutorial on music. after you get that, just mess with it a little bit, make a boolean method that checks if your in a certain area, and then if you are, play this music.

I have a music player, just one problem, i have no idea how to make a process, but could the process read off coords?

Read full topic

I believe back in '07 silab posted a tutorial on music. after you get that, just mess with it a little bit, make a boolean method that checks if your in a certain area, and then if you are, play this music.
